name: StringDescription
comment: The default implementation of IDescription. This should rarely need substitution, although conceivably it is a place where other languages could be supported.

addAll.name: addAll
addAll.comment: Append an [Iterable] [list] of objects to the description, using the specified scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.separator and framing the list with scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.start and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.end.

addDescriptionOf.name: addDescriptionOf
addDescriptionOf.comment: Appends a description of scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addDescriptionOf.value. If it is an IMatcher use its describe method; if it is a string use its literal value after escaping any embedded control characters; otherwise use its toString() value and wrap it in angular "quotes".

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

add.name: add
add.comment: This is used to add arbitrary text to the description.

addAll.name: addAll
addAll.comment: This is used to add a description of an [Iterable] [list], with appropriate scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.start and scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.end markers and inter-element scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.addAll.separator.

addDescriptionOf.name: addDescriptionOf
addDescriptionOf.comment: This is used to add a meaningful description of a value.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of scheduled_test/scheduled_test.StringDescription.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
